metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14098 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the pjsip channel driver (res_pjsip) in Asterisk 13.x before 13.17.1 and 14.x before 14.6.1, a carefully crafted tel URI in a From, To, or Contact header could cause Asterisk to crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-14098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-config - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-modules - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-tests - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1').
